solution.text:
No. of defective springs \(=21\)
Total no. of springs in the consignment \(=700\)
As a single defective spring is enough for the consignment to be rejected,
probability of the consignment being rejected = \(\frac{21}{700}\)
\(=\frac{3}{100}\)

content.text: In order to clear a consignment of springs, the quality of \(1\) spring selected at random is examined. If it is found to be of good quality, the consignment is cleared. In a consignment of 700 springs, 21 springs are defective. What is the probability that the consignment will be rejected?
